info.name: Spinal cord, ventral horn
info.description: The ventral horn of the spinal cord is AKA the anterior horn of the spinal cord. It is a major division of the spinal cord gray matter that contains the lower motor neurons (AKA anterior horn cells) that innervate the skeletal muscles of the body. These lower motor neurons include alpha motor neurons that innervate extrafusal muscle fibers and gamma motor neurons that innervate the intrafusal fibers of the muscle spindles.  At the level of the lumbar and cervical enlargements, the lateral aspect of the ventral horn is enlarged and contains the lower motor neurons innervating the limbs.  This area is known as the lateral motor cell column.  The more medial aspect of the ventral horn contains the lower motor neurons innervating axial structures; it is known as the medial motor cell column and is present at all levels of the spinal cord.
